00029 
00030 /** Initializes a Timeout structure.
00031 
00032     @param
00033     timeout : the Timeout structure to be initialized.
00034 
00035     @param [in]
00036     nSeconds : number of seconds until timeout occurs. If 0 timeout always
00037     occurs, if (unsigned)-1 timeout never occurs.
00038 
00039     @memberof Timeout
00040 */
00041 
00042 TC2API void timeout_init(Timeout* timeout, uint nSeconds)
00043 {
00044    timeout->start = time(NULL);
00045    timeout->nSeconds = nSeconds;
00046 }
00047 
00048 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00049 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00050 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00051 
00052 /** Queries remaining time (in seconds) in a Timeout structure.
00053 
00054     @param [in]
00055     timeout : the Timeout structure to be queried
00056 
00057     @return
00058     number of seconds until timeout occurs
00059 
00060     @memberof Timeout
00061 */
00062 
00063 TC2API uint timeout_remaining(const Timeout* timeout)
00064 {
00065    time_t now;
00066    uint elapsed;
00067 
00068    // has timeout been configured to always expire?
00069    if (!timeout->nSeconds)
00070       return 0; // yes, so timeout expired
00071 
00072    // has timeout been configured to never expire ?
00073    if (timeout->nSeconds == TIMEOUT_WAIT_FOREVER)
00074       return TIMEOUT_WAIT_FOREVER; // yes, so timeout did not expire
00075 
00076    // now, checks the elapsed time
00077 
00078    now = time(NULL);
00079    elapsed = (uint)(now - timeout->start);
00080 
00081    // has timeout expired ?
00082    if (elapsed >= timeout->nSeconds)
00083       return 0; // yes, timeout expired
00084 
00085    // no, timeout did not expire
00086    return timeout->nSeconds - elapsed;
00087 }
00088 
00089 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00090 // the end
